decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to cast a powerful combo spell, such as Ad Nauseam or Tendrils of Agony, to win the game in a single turn. This is achieved through a combination of fast mana acceleration, card selection/filtering, disruption of the opponent's hand, and the ability to tutor for key pieces of the combo. The deck leverages cards like Dark Ritual, Burning Wish, and Infernal Tutor to generate mana and find crucial combo pieces, while also using discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf to apply early pressure on the opponent. By disrupting their opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will, Daze, Spell Snare, and Spell Pierce, as well as disrupting their mana base with Wasteland, the deck aims to establish control of the game and overwhelm the opponent quickly. The deck also has a good amount of card selection and card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find its key cards and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on casting cheap and efficient spells to control the board while also being able to deal a significant amount of damage quickly. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Spell Pierce, while also applying pressure with creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck can consistently find the right answers and threats to outpace the opponent. Wasteland also helps to cripple the opponent's mana base, giving the deck a further advantage in the game.

The main idea of this deck is to use cards like Show and Tell, Sneak Attack, and Omniscience to quickly put powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play. By using fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, as well as card filtering spells like Ponder and Brainstorm, this deck aims to cheat these huge threats into play early in the game and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond. It is a high-risk, high-reward combo deck that can win games in just a few turns.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through aggressive creatures and disruptive spells while leveraging the synergy between creatures and artifacts. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Aether Vial, you can slow down your opponent's plays and protect your own threats. Stoneforge Mystic and equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice provide additional value and utility in combat. The deck aims to pressure the opponent with efficient creatures while controlling the board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Karakas.

The main idea of this deck is to employ a control strategy by utilizing various counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to establish dominance through cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Monastery Mentor, generating value and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Counterbalance and Snapcaster Mage allows for versatility in dealing with different threats. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful finishers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Entreat the Angels to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

The deck aims to quickly cheat out powerful creatures, such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand, using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The key strategy is to use cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Flusterstorm to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card selection and manipulation with cards like Ponder and Preordain to set up the combo. The mana base is built to support the high mana cost of the creatures, with tools like Lotus Petal and land acceleration.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf. The deck aims to control the game through countering spells, bouncing lands, and removing threats, all while maintaining a solid board presence. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the deck's diverse range of spells. By combining disruption and aggression, this deck seeks to outpace and overwhelm the opponent in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on applying fast and consistent pressure through efficient creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler, supported by disruption spells like Spell Pierce and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board with cheap removal like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland, while also maintaining card advantage with Delver of Secrets and Baleful Strix. By combining aggressive threats with strong disruption, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in order to secure victory.

The main theme of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to control the game with card advantage provided by cards like Baleful Strix and Snapcaster Mage, while also generating value through cards like Kolaghan's Command and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck uses a combination of counterspells and removal spells to control the board and eventually win through powerful threats like Gurmag Angler and Liliana, the Last Hope.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal, while utilizing powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Batterskull to gain an advantage over opponents. With a mix of card draw and disruption, the deck aims to outmaneuver opponents and maintain board control. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for consistent access to equipment, while True-Name Nemesis and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and facilitate smooth casting of spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently win the game by utilizing infect creatures such as Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf, along with pump spells and protection spells to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck focuses on being aggressive and proactive, while also having some disruptive elements with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its key creatures. The mana base is built to support the deck's efficient gameplay, with fetch lands and dual lands allowing for consistent mana fixing and acceleration.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. Utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Mother of Runes to slow down the opponent's spells and protect your own creatures, while also utilizing disruptive lands like Wasteland and Rishadan Port to disrupt their mana base. The deck also includes powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to further enhance your creatures. Ultimately, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also setting up a win condition with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo. Life from the Loam is used to continuously recycle lands and Punishing Fire provides removal for threats. Crop Rotation helps find key lands like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale or Karakas. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources with Wasteland and Rishadan Port, while also generating value with Exploration and Mox Diamond. The overall strategy is to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through land manipulation and control.

The deck focuses on playing threats that are difficult to deal with efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan. It aims to apply pressure early with creatures like Tarmogoyf and True-Name Nemesis while controlling the board with cards like Force of Will and Abrupt Decay. The deck also utilizes card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Sylvan Library to maintain a steady stream of threats and answers. By combining aggression with disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent in a game of attrition.

The main concept of this Aggro Canadian Threshold deck is to control the pace of the game through efficient removal and counterspells while also applying pressure with fast and evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Nimble Mongoose, and Tarmogoyf. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Stifle and Wasteland, while also maintaining card advantage and filtering through the deck with Ponder and Brainstorm. Overall, the strategy is to quickly deal damage and close out the game before the opponent can establish their own board presence.
